result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean G Olson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: St. Croix County Case No. 08CF194 and Oneida County Case No. 10CF217.
Concurrent with: Trempealeau County Case No. 15CF74.

superMiscConds.notes: Ordered joint and several with Melissa Kurth, in Jackson County Case No. 15CF163.    Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.   Any remaining due shall be paid monthly through extended supervision. If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  Any remaining due shall be paid monthly through extended supervision. If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Seek and maintain full time employment.  Not to terminate employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with the victims Melrose Farm Services/Alma Center Feed Mill, R.D. or M.S.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Undergo criminal thinking programming if agent recommends.

defendant.name: Olson, Dean G, Jr

records.addlTxt: from DOC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Arraignment Plea/Sentencing Hearing held 08/08/2016

Defendant plead  no contest to Count 1 as amended in the information.  Dismiss, but read in Counts 2 and 3.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.   Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, contrary to 943.10(1m)(a).  Joint recommendation for:       7 years total.  Concurrent to sentence now serving. 2 5 no contact with the victim.  Restitution $557.00, AODA and recommended treatment.  Undergo Criminal thinking program, agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  7 year sentence. Consecutive to revocation sentence now serving, and concurrent to sentence imposed in Tremp Co.  3 years initial confinement, and 4 years extended supervision.  No contact with the victims feed mill, R.D. or M.S.  Pay restitution $557.00 joint and several, and surcharges.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Undergo criminal thinking programming if agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. CC.  s/m full time employment.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Subject to random testing by his agent.  Eligible for CIP & SAP.   Pay rest and cc monthly during es.
Reading of the information waived.
Information filed with the Court.

He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  with victim names in the complaint.

Defendant appears in person by video from Stanley Correctional.  His counsel, Gina Bosben is appearing by phone.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defense waives the reading of the complaint and he stands mute and waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Court reviews the right to a prelim within the time limits.  Court accepts his waiver of time limits to hold the preliminary hearing.  Court sets pre-trial for 6-22 at 10:00 and a status for 7-11 at 3:00.  Attorney Bosben may call in for the status and the defendant will not need to appear.  Court sets bond as requested by the State.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant appears by video from Stanley Correctional Institution without counsel present in the courtroom.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.

Defendant appears by video from Stanley Correctional Institution without counsel present in the courtroom.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant admits to receipt of complaint and has read it.  Court reviews charges and potential penalties.  Defendant states that he understands.  Defendant states he wrote his previous attorney Charles Betthauser and also wrote to SPDO in BRF; has not heard from either of them.  Court will contact the SPDO have the them contact SCI.  Other attorney options explained.  AIA will be rescheduled when/if counsel is appointed.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 5, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Defendant appeared by video from Stanley Correctional.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from Stanley Correctional.  No counsel present.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  Defendant understood.  Court advised the defendant of his attorney options.  Contact SPD.  5/5/16 at 11:15 am.  Defendant to appear by video.
